data.title: Santa's Gift Sorting
data.solution:
# Define order.
order = "metal, wooden, plastic, paper, electronic, glass".split(", ")

# Get gifts and create array.
gifts = []
n = int(input())
assert n<50,"N is larger than 50"
for i in range(n):
    name, type = input().split(",")
    assert len(name) < 50, f"Input - {name+','+type} is larger than 50"  
    assert type in order, f"Type is not valid: {type}"
    assert all(1 for char in name if char.isalpha() or char == " "), f"Invalid character in name: {name}"
    gifts.append([type,name])

# Print gifts ordered based on type then name.
for _,gift in sorted(gifts, key = lambda gift : (order.index(gift[0]),gift[1])):
    print(gift)
data.statement:
Santa and the Elves have been hard at work creating [[gifts]] and have created a list of all the [[gifts]]. Each [[gift]] has a [[name]] and an associated [[type]]. The goal is to help Santa sort them in the order they should be placed in the sleigh to avoid damaging any.

<<Types of Gifts:>>
There are 6 [[types]] of [[gift]]. The order from <<LEAST>> fragile to <<MOST>> fragile is: {{metal}}, {{wooden}}, {{plastic}}, {{paper}}, {{electronic}}, {{glass}} 

<<Ordering:>>
The [[gifts]] need to be placed in the sleigh from <<LEAST>> fragile to <<MOST>> fragile to avoid damaging any.
In the event more than one [[gift]] has the same [[type]], order based on <<ALPHABETICAL ORDER>> by [[name]].

testCases.title: One of Each Type
testCases.testIn:
6
xbox,electronic
frying pan,metal
spoon,wooden
snow globe,glass
book,paper
hot wheels,plastic
testCases.testOut:
frying pan
spoon
hot wheels
book
xbox
snow globe

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
6
abcde,glass
rdtgg,wooden
awdawd,plastic
jawd jawdj,paper
ujawd iadw,metal
adwk adwk,electronic
testCases.testOut:
ujawd iadw
rdtgg
awdawd
jawd jawdj
adwk adwk
abcde

data.constraints:
1 ≤ [[n]] ≤ 50
1 ≤ Length of [[name]] ≤ 50
[[type]] ∈ { {{metal}}, {{wooden}}, {{plastic}}, {{paper}}, {{electronic}}, {{glass}} }
A [[name]] contains only English alphabetical characters and spaces.

data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Integer [[n]] representing the number of [[gifts]]
<<Next [[n]] Lines:>> Comma separated string representing a [[gift]] in the form: [[name]]{{,}}[[type]]
data.outputDescription: <<[[n]] Lines:>> String [[name]] of [[gift]] that is to be placed in the sleigh in the order described in the statement.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Santa and the Elves have been hard at work creating gifts and have created a list of all the gifts. Each gift has a name and an associated type. The goal is to help Santa sort them in the order they should be placed in the sleigh to avoid damaging any.

Types of Gifts:
There are 6 types of gift. The order from LEAST fragile to MOST fragile is: metal, wooden, plastic, paper, electronic, glass

Ordering:
The gifts need to be placed in the sleigh from LEAST fragile to MOST fragile to avoid damaging any.
In the event more than one gift has the same type, order based on ALPHABETICAL ORDER by name.
Input
Line 1: Integer n representing the number of gifts
Next n Lines: Comma separated string representing a gift in the form: name,type
Output
n Lines: String name of gift that is to be placed in the sleigh in the order described in the statement.
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 50
1 ≤ Length of name ≤ 50
type ∈ { metal, wooden, plastic, paper, electronic, glass }
A name contains only English alphabetical characters and spaces.
Example
Input
6
xbox,electronic
frying pan,metal
spoon,wooden
snow globe,glass
book,paper
hot wheels,plastic
Output
frying pan
spoon
hot wheels
book
xbox
snow globe
